trs: Their first task was to cook food, make shoes, get water and carry blankets into the tent. They also started hauling [killed] animals, drying meat, making fires to make the meat dry faster, kneading skins to soften them, separating the skin from the reindeer legs [kamus], procuring birch bark and treating the skins with smoke.

html:
bəje-di hawa-tin o-da-n həsi-r-wə kaŋna-l-da-tin nʼur-i-l-wa hiwo-l-lə oro-r-wo oni-l-la kurgə-mnə ija-du mo-la-ŋnə dʼaw-i-l-wa simiː-l-lə əptilə-l-wə itə-l-wə niŋtə-l-wə kiglo-l-wo o-dʼa-ɣin suksillə-l-wə noku-l-wə taku-l-i-gin haraː-r-wə əri-gin əri-wu-r-wə oli-gin

srcwordsbare: bəje-di hawa-tin o-da-n həsi-r-wə kaŋna-l-da-tin nʼur-i-l-wa hiwo-l-lə oro-r-wo oni-l-la kurgə-mnə ija-du mo-la-ŋnə dʼaw-i-l-wa simiː-l-lə əptilə-l-wə itə-l-wə niŋtə-l-wə kiglo-l-wo o-dʼa-ɣin suksillə-l-wə noku-l-wə taku-l-i-gin haraː-r-wə əri-gin əri-wu-r-wə oli-gin
trs: The men's work consisted of planing handles, sharpening arrowheads, searching for reindeer, preparing skins in the forge, collecting firewood, making side planks for the boats, making ribs and boards for the floor, preparing roots [for sewing together birch bark boat shells], making leather gloves, making skis covered with skins, setting up supply stores, preparing the place for the tent, making shovels.
